intro: Alsinanthus rotundifolius, commonly known as the roundleaf alsike, is a flowering plant in the legume family, Fabaceae. It is native to western North America, particularly found in California and Oregon. The plant is characterized by its rounded, heart-shaped leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in early spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed areas. Alsinanthus rotundifolius is an annual plant that plays a role in soil stabilization and provides nectar for pollinators.
